thread.title: Kings Mountain sweeps singles to advance in 3A tennis
thread.title_full: Kings Mountain sweeps singles to advance in 3A tennis

author: Staff reports
title: Kings Mountain sweeps singles to advance in 3A tennis
text: Kings Mountain sweeps singles to advance in 3A tennis Kings Mountain remained unbeaten and will now host HIckory on Oct. 27 in the second round of the 3A girls' dual-team state playoffs. Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 11:33 PM Updated at 11:37 PM Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 11:33 PM Updated at 11:37 PM KINGS MOUNTAIN â€“ The SMAC champion Kings Mountain girls tennis team entered the 3A playoffs Tuesday night with an unbeaten record. The Lady Mountaineers remained unscathed by sweeping all six singles matches in a contest that finished late under the lights on the Kings Mountain High campus. Next up for the 13-0 Kings Mountain is a second round encounter with a 10-1 Hickory squad that rolled past Ashbrook 9-0 in the opening round. Coach Rick Henderson's squad and Hickory will collide on Oct. 27 on the Mountaineer courts. Kings Mountain Freshman first seed Natalie Lutz defeated Holly Griffin from North Iredell 6-0, 6-0. Kassie Johnson, MC Johnson, Carrigan Leatherman, Amber Belcher and Kayla Condrey all bagged singles victories as well. By Staff reports
